abstract.text: A format specification for an audio stream.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: You can configure an audio stream basic description (ASBD) to specify a linear PCM format or a constant bit rate (CBR) format that has channels of equal size. For variable bit rate (VBR) audio, and for CBR audio where the channels have unequal sizes, also use an
structure to additionally describe each packet.
indicates that the value is either unknown or not applicable to the format.
Always initialize the fields of a new audio stream basic description structure to
To determine the duration that one packet represents, use the
In Core Audio, the following definitions apply:
is a continuous series of data that represents a sound, such as a song.
is a discrete track of monophonic audio. A monophonic stream has one channel; a stereo stream has two channels.
is single numerical value for a single audio channel in an audio stream.
is a collection of time-coincident samples. For instance, a linear PCM stereo sound file has two samples per frame, one for the left channel and one for the right channel.

is a collection of one or more contiguous frames. A packet defines the smallest meaningful set of frames for a given audio data format, and is the smallest data unit for which time can be measured. In linear PCM audio, a packet holds a single frame. In compressed formats, it typically holds more frames. In some formats, the number of frames per packet varies.
for a stream is the number of frames per second of uncompressed audio, or, for compressed formats, the equivalent in decompressed audio.

abstract.text: Use specialized data types to interact with audio streams, complex buffers, and audiovisual timestamps.
A type definition for audio format flags.
A type definition for audio format identifiers.
A format specification for an audio stream.
Creates an empty description.
Creates a description with the specified values.
The number of bits for one audio sample.
The number of bytes from the start of one frame to the start of the next frame in an audio buffer.
The number of bytes in a packet of audio data.
The number of channels in each frame of audio data.
Format-specific flags to specify details of the format.
An identifier specifying the general audio data format in the stream.
The number of frames in a packet of audio data.
The amount to pad the structure to force an even 8-byte alignment.
The number of frames per second of the data in the stream, when playing the stream at normal speed.
A value that describes a packet in a buffer of audio data.
Constants that define the type of MPEG-4 audio data.
Commonly used combinations of data format flags for an audio stream description.
Identifiers for supported audio formats.
A value that indicates that an audio stream can use any sample rate.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
